instruction: What are the names of some famous actors that started their careers on Broadway?
output:
Here are some famous actors that got their start on Broadway:

• Marilyn Monroe - started as a model and did some minor Broadway roles before becoming a Hollywood star

• Denzel Washington - starred in Broadway shows like A Soldier's Play before his film career took off

• Morgan Freeman - performed as an understudy in The Naked Rabbit on Broadway early in his career

• Viola Davis - starred in Broadway shows like King Hedley II and Intimate Apparel before transitioning to film and TV

• Robert De Niro - had roles in Broadway shows like Wedding Party and The Wedding of the Son early in his career

• Liza Minnelli - starred in Broadway shows like Flora the Red Menace and The Sterile Cuckoo as a teen before moving to film

• Angela Lansbury - was a Broadway star for decades, starring in shows like Gaslight, Sweeney Todd, and Mame before taking on film and TV roles

• Samuel L. Jackson - performed in several Broadway shows like A Soldier's Play and Julius Caesar early in his career

• Anne Bancroft - starred in Two for the Seesaw and The Miracle Worker on Broadway, winning Tony awards before moving to film

• Tommy Lee Jones - performed in Broadway shows like A Patriot for Me and The Amazing Adele early in his career

That's a great list of famous actors who got their start on the Broadway stage. Many of them really honed their craft performing in front of live audiences before transitioning to successful film and television careers.

instruction: How did US states get their names?
output:
US states got their names from a variety of sources:

• Native American names - Many states have names derived from Native American words, like Massachusetts, Mississippi, Illinois, etc. These are often names of tribes, landmarks or geographical features.

• European places - Some states are named after places in Europe, like New York, New Jersey, New Hampshire, etc. Or named after European monarchs or figures, like Maryland, Virginia, Georgia, etc.

• Descriptive names - Some states got names describing their geography or climate, like Colorado (colorful), Montana (mountainous), Nevada (snowy), etc.

• Spanish or French names - States like California, Florida, Texas, etc. have names derived from Spanish or French words used during early exploration.

• American leaders or figures - States like Washington, Columbia (old name for Washington DC), Pennsylvania (Penn's woods), etc. were named to honor important leaders or figures.

• Classical names - A few states have names derived from classical Latin or Greek, like Arizona (arid zone) or Idaho (gem of the mountains).

• Made-up names - Some state names were essentially made up or of unclear origin, like Oklahoma, Wyoming, etc. The exact reasons for their naming are not always certain.

• Slogans - A couple states were named from slogans, like North and South Dakota (allied tribes) or Kentucky (meadow land).

So in summary, a mix of native words, European colonial history, natural features, leaders' names, and a bit of creativity all combined to produce the names of the 50 US states.

instruction: Hi, my sister and her girlfriends want me to play kickball with them. Can you explain how the game is played, so they don't take advantage of me?
output:
Sure, here's a quick overview of how kickball is played:

• Two teams of players take turns kicking and fielding. When kicking, your team tries to score runs by having players circle the bases. When fielding, your team tries to get outs by throwing the ball at the base ahead of the runner.

• The game starts with the kicking team at bat. The pitcher rolls a large rubber playground ball to the kicker, who tries to kick it into play. The kicker runs to first base while the fielding team tries to get them out.

• Teams get 3 outs per inning, either by forcing outs at a base or by catching a fly ball in the air. Outs can be made by throwing the ball to a base ahead of the runner or by tagging them with the ball.

• Runners can be forced out at a base if a fielder with the ball beats them to the base. Runners can also be tagged out if a fielder tags them with the ball before they reach a base.

• Runs are scored by runners completing a circuit around all the bases and returning to home plate. Teams continue alternating between kicking and fielding for a set number of innings, usually around 3 to 5 innings.

• Standard baseball rules apply for balls, strikes, fouls, outs, etc. The main differences are that the ball is rolled rather than pitched, and fielders can get outs by throwing to bases or tagging runners with the ball.

• Most importantly, have fun! Don't take the game too seriously. Kickball should be a fun, recreational game. If your sister and friends do start taking advantage, just laugh it off and focus on enjoying some time outside together. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: What is some cool music from the 1920s?
output:
Here are some cool music styles and songs from the 1920s:

• Jazz music became hugely popular in the 1920s. Artists like Louis Armstrong, Duke Ellington, and Benny Goodman helped define the jazz sound. Some iconic jazz songs from the era include "Take the 'A' Train" by Duke Ellington and "Singin' the Blues" by Frankie Trumbauer and Bix Beiderbecke.

• The Charleston dance craze led to upbeat songs like "The Charleston" by James P. Johnson and "Black Bottom Stomp" by Jelly Roll Morton.

• Classic blues singers like Bessie Smith and Ma Rainey were popular. Some well-known blues songs from the 1920s include "St. Louis Blues" by Bessie Smith and "See See Rider Blues" by Ma Rainey.

• Folk music and country music were also popular genres. Artists like The Carter Family helped bring old-time folk and country music to the mainstream. Their hit "Will the Circle Be Unbroken" was popular in the 1920s.

• Show tunes and big band music became popular with the rise of musicals, revues, and orchestras. George Gershwin's "Rhapsody in Blue" and Irving Berlin's "Puttin' On the Ritz" are iconic '20s show tunes.

• Novelty songs with nonsensical lyrics were popular for a brief time. Songs like "Yes! We Have No Bananas" and "Barney Google" were silly hits that captured the frivolous spirit of the era.

• The flappers had their own music like "Ain't We Got Fun" and "The Flapper Wife." These songs captured the carefree attitude of the flapper generation.

That covers some of the cool music styles and songs that were popular in the 1920s. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: How do I wrap a present neatly?
output:
Here are some tips for wrapping a present neatly:

• Use high quality wrapping paper. Thicker paper is easier to work with and looks more polished. Make sure you have enough paper to cover the entire gift with some extra.

• Use tape generously. Place pieces of tape approximately every 6 to 8 inches to keep the wrapping paper securely in place.

• Use scissors to cut the wrapping paper to the proper size. Make sure you have clean cuts at right angles. An alternative is to use a paper cutter for straight edges.

• Fold all raw edges of the wrapping paper under for a neat appearance. Secure the folds in place with tape.

• Place the gift in the center of the wrapping paper. Make sure any writing or patterns on the paper are straight and aligned.

• Fold one corner of the wrapping paper over the gift, then take the opposite corner and fold it over. Secure both corners in place with tape.

• Repeat with the remaining two corners, folding one at a time and securing each with tape as you go.

• Add ribbon and a bow to finish it off. Place ribbon around the wrapped gift at a diagonal or horizontal and tie off with a bow. You can also use double-sided tape to adhere the bow directly to the wrapping paper.

• Neatly trim off any excess wrapping paper around the edges for a sharp, tailored look.

• Clearly label the gift or include a gift tag to indicate who it is for and from.

• Practice makes perfect. If you have trouble wrapping neatly at first, keep at it and your skills will improve over time. With regular gift-giving occasions, you'll be wrapping like a pro in no time.

instruction: How do I dice without slicing my finger
output:
Here are some tips for dicing without cutting yourself:

• Use a sharp knife. A dull knife requires more force and is more likely to slip. Sharpen your knife or use a knife sharpener to make sure it's razor sharp.

• Curl your fingers under. Keep your fingers curled under and tucked in toward your palm. Only expose the area of the vegetable you are cutting. This way your fingers are never in the path of the knife.

• Use a stable cutting board. A cutting board that slides around is dangerous. Make sure your cutting board is stable and secure on the countertop. A damp kitchen towel under the board can help prevent slipping.

• Cut in multiple passes. Don't try to cut all the way through the vegetable in one stroke. Make multiple lighter passes, slicing a little bit at a time. This gives you more control and less chance of the knife slipping.

• Hold the vegetable steady. Hold the vegetable steady with your non-dominant hand and cut using your dominant hand. Make sure you have a good, secure grip to minimize movement.

• Go slowly. Take your time and go slowly, especially when you first start dicing. Rushing can lead to slips and cuts. Slow, precise cuts are the safest.

• Use a knife guard. When not in use, keep your knife in a knife guard or sheath. This covers the sharp blade and prevents cuts when reaching into a drawer.

• Consider cut-resistant gloves. If you are prone to frequent cutting, consider wearing cut-resistant gloves. These provide protection while still allowing dexterity.

• Pay attention. Focus on the task at hand and avoid distractions. Pay close attention to how you are cutting and holding the vegetable and knife. Staying focused helps avoid slips and cuts.

With practice, dicing will become second nature and feel more comfortable. But always put safety first to avoid cutting yourself. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: Hi, I'm trying to solve a crossword puzzle, but I've never done one of these before. Can you help me out?
output:
Sure, I'd be happy to provide some tips for solving crossword puzzles:

• Look for short or common words to fill in first. These are usually easier to figure out and can help you deduce the answers for crossing words.

• Look for prefixes, suffixes and word patterns. Many crosswords contain word fragments like "pre-" or "-ed" or word patterns like "cat"-"cot"-"cut". These can be good clues.

• Look for connectors like "and" or "the" which can link two separate words or phrases. 

• Look for puns, anagrams and other wordplay. Crossword makers frequently use these to tie the theme together.

• Look for themes or patterns that span multiple words and clues. Some crosswords have an overarching theme that can help you figure out the trickier clues.

• Make educated guesses for letters you're unsure of. You can always erase them later if needed. Even guessing one letter can help you deduce others.

• Look for short clues that could be synonyms or abbreviations. These often indicate a short word or phrase.

• Don't be afraid to use references like dictionaries, thesauruses or almanacs. They can be a big help, especially for more difficult puzzles.

• Keep an open and flexible mind. Some clues and answers will surprise you! Double check your assumptions.

• With practice, you'll get faster and better at solving. Don't get discouraged if the first few stump you. Keep at it and have fun!

Let me know if you have any other questions. I'm happy to provide more specific help for the crossword you're working on if needed. Good luck!

instruction: Who is Larry Page?
output:
Larry Page is an American computer scientist and Internet entrepreneur who co-founded Google with Sergey Brin. Some key facts about Larry Page:

• He co-founded Google in 1998 along with Sergey Brin. They were PhD students at Stanford at the time.

• Larry Page served as Google's CEO from 1998 to 2001 and again from 2011 to 2015. Currently he is the CEO of Alphabet Inc., the parent company of Google.

• Larry Page is known for his visionary and ambitious style of leadership. Under his guidance, Google has expanded into many new products and services including search, Gmail, Google Maps, Android mobile operating system, Google Cloud and more.

• Larry Page has a net worth of over $50 billion US dollars, making him one of the wealthiest people in the world.

• He was born in 1973 in Michigan. He earned a computer engineering degree from the University of Michigan and a MS in computer science from Stanford University.

• Larry Page is passionate about renewable energy and sustainability. He has invested in companies like Tesla Motors and funded an organization called The Climate Reality Project.

• Larry Page is an intensely private person. He rarely does press interviews and public appearances. He lets his work at Google and Alphabet speak for itself.

• He has won many accolades and honors over the years including the Marconi Prize in 2004 and induction into the Internet Hall of Fame in 2013.

That's a high-level overview of Larry Page, the co-founder and technology visionary behind Google and Alphabet. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: What are different drawers I should have for clothes?
output:
Some useful drawers to have for organizing your clothes include:

• Sock drawer - For organizing matching pairs of socks. You can use drawer dividers to keep different types of socks separate.

• Undergarment drawer - For organizing undergarments like briefs, boxers, bras, camisoles, etc. Again, drawer dividers can help keep different types separate.

• T-shirt drawer - For t-shirts, tank tops and other casual tops. You can roll or fold the t-shirts to save space.

• Pajama drawer - For pajamas, night suits and other sleepwear.

• Accessory drawer - For smaller accessories like belts, scarves, watches, jewelry, hair ties, etc. Use compartments or dividers to avoid tangled mess.

• Sweater drawer - For knit sweaters, cardigans and other lighter sweaters. Fold or roll to maximize space.

• Pant drawer - For pants, jeans, shorts, skirts, etc. You can fold pants to save space. Use pant hangers for dressier pants.

• Workout drawer - For workout clothes like shorts, t-shirts, sports bras, sweatpants, etc. 

• Dresser top - For items you use frequently like wallets, chargers, keys, sunglasses, makeup bag, hair brushes, etc. Add trays or dividers to keep organized.

• Seasonal storage - For out-of-season clothing like heavy jackets, beachwear, winter accessories, etc. Use labeled boxes to store.

• Laundry hamper - For dirty clothes. Have separate hampers for whites, colors and delicates. 

Using a combination of these drawers and proper organization techniques can help keep your clothing neat, tidy and easy to find. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Georgian  dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Kubdari?
output:
Sure, Kubdari is a traditional Georgian stuffed dumpling. The ingredients you will need are:

For the dough:

•2 cups all-purpose flour

•1/2 cup warm water

•1/4 cup vegetable oil

•1/2 teaspoon salt

For the filling:

•1 pound ground beef or lamb

•1 onion, finely chopped

•1/2 cup chopped parsley

•1 teaspoon red wine vinegar

•1/2 teaspoon salt

•Black pepper to taste

To make the dough:

1. Mix the flour, salt, and oil in a bowl. Add the warm water gradually and knead into a smooth dough.

2. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.

To make the filling:

1. Combine the ground meat, onion, parsley, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Mix well.

To assemble:

1. Roll out the dough thinly and cut into circles, about 6 to 8 inches in diameter.

2. Place 1-2 tablespoons of the filling in the middle of each dough circle.

3. Fold the dough over and seal the edges with a fork to form half-moon shapes.

4. Boil the dumplings in salted water until they float to the surface, about 3-5 minutes.

5. Serve hot with garlic yogurt, vinegar and chili dipping sauce.

6. You can also pan-fry the boiled dumplings to get them nicely browned.

7. Garnish with parsley if desired. Enjoy! Kubdari is best served hot. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: do you think retinoid is effective on removing the acne? because I have a lot of it
output:
Retinoids can be effective for acne treatment. Here are some key points about retinoids and acne:

• Retinoids are derived from vitamin A and work by increasing cell turnover in the skin. This helps to unclog pores and prevent blackheads and whiteheads. They are often used to treat moderate to severe acne.

• Common retinoids for acne include adapalene (Differin), tretinoin (Retin-A), and isotretinoin (Accutane). They come in topical creams, gels, and oral medications.

• Retinoids can help reduce inflammation, unclog pores, and prevent new acne lesions from forming. However, it can take several weeks of use before seeing the full benefits. It may cause skin irritation at first, so low concentrations are often started and then gradually increased.

• Oral retinoids like isotretinoin are very effective for severe or persistent acne. A full course of isotretinoin treatment can clear up acne for many years. However, it can have side effects like dry skin, joint pain, and increased sun sensitivity.

• For the best results, retinoids are often combined with other acne treatments like benzoyl peroxide, antibiotics, and light or laser therapy.

• Retinoid treatment may need to be continued long-term to prevent acne from returning. Maintenance treatment is often at a lower dose and frequency.

• While retinoids can be very effective for many people, they do not work for everyone. It may take trying different retinoids or combinations of treatments to achieve good results.

So in summary, yes retinoids can be effective for acne removal, especially for moderate to severe acne. However, it may take patience and consistency to see good results. For your acne, you should consult a dermatologist for a proper diagnosis and to discuss which retinoid options may work best based on the severity and type of your acne.

instruction: I'm trying to teach myself to have nicer handwriting. Can you help?
output:
Here are some tips to improve your handwriting:

• Practice the basics. Focus on holding your pen or pencil correctly and maintaining good posture. Sit up straight and hold your writing implement at a 45-degree angle. Make sure your letters are evenly sized and spaced.

• Go slowly. Many people have messy handwriting because they rush through writing. Take your time and be deliberate with each letter. Aim for quality over quantity.

• Pay attention to letter formation. Make sure each letter is clearly formed. Focus on smooth lines and consistent shapes. The most common letters people struggle with are e, a, s, and f. Practice them individually.

• Do handwriting exercises. Things like tracing dotted lines, writing the alphabet, and doing figure eights can help strengthen your hands and improve dexterity. Start with basic lines and curves before moving on to complete letters.

• Focus on one letter or word at a time. If your handwriting is very messy, tackling the entire alphabet at once can be overwhelming. Pick one letter or a short word to practice each day. Take it slow and be meticulous. Over time, you'll improve.

• Practice daily. Set aside time each day to do handwriting exercises and practice your skills. Even practicing for just 15 or 20 minutes a day 4-5 times a week can make a big difference. Repetition and consistency are key.

• Get guidance. If you're still struggling, consider working with an occupational therapist who can provide personalized guidance and exercises to help improve your handwriting. They can also determine if there are any underlying issues impacting your handwriting skills.

With regular practice and patience, you can strengthen your handwriting skills and develop neater, more consistent handwriting. Stay focused on quality over quantity and keep at it each and every day. You'll get there with time and practice!

instruction: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Somali  dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Canjeero?
output:
Sure, here is a recipe for Canjeero, which is a popular Somali flatbread:

Ingredients:

•2 cups sorghum flour or whole wheat flour

•1/2 cup warm water

•1/4 teaspoon salt

•2 tablespoons vegetable oil

•Additional oil for cooking

 Instructions:

1. Mix the flour, salt, and warm water into a smooth batter with a pouring consistency. Cover and let it stand in a warm place for 2-3 hours.

2. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour or ladle the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each canjeero.

3. Tilt the skillet to spread the batter evenly. Cook until the bottom is light brown, about 2 minutes.

4. Brush the top with some of the 2 tablespoons of oil. Flip and cook the other side until lightly browned, about 1 minute more.

5. Fold the canjeero in half, and then in half again to form a triangle. Repeat with the remaining batter.

6. Stack the canjeero on a plate and cover with a towel to keep warm. Serve warm or at room temperature.

7. Canjeero is usually eaten for breakfast with honey, molasses, butter, or suugo, a spicy beef and tomato sauce. Enjoy!

Let me know if you have any other questions. I can provide recipes for suugo or other Somali dishes if you like.

instruction: What are the best exercises for beginners?
output:
Here are some of the best exercises for beginners:

• Walking - Walking is a great form of exercise for beginners. It provides moderate aerobic exercise without the impact of running. Aim for at least 30-60 minutes of brisk walking most days of the week.

• Bodyweight exercises - Exercises like pushups, squats, lunges, sit-ups, etc. that use your own body weight are perfect for beginners. They require no equipment and can be done anywhere. Start with easier variations and build up as you get stronger.

• Yoga or Tai Chi - Yoga and Tai Chi are gentle exercises that are suitable for beginners. They increase your flexibility and strength through controlled movements and balance. They are also great for both the mind and body.

• Light strength training - Use dumbbells or resistance bands to do some simple strength training. Exercises like shoulder presses, rows, bicep curls, triceps extensions, etc. Start with lighter weights and higher reps, around 2-3 pounds weights and 15-20 reps per set.

• Swimming - Swimming is a full body workout that is easy on the joints. It provides an aerobic workout without the impact of walking or jogging. Swim at a leisurely pace, mixing different strokes like freestyle, backstroke and breaststroke.

• Stationary cycling - Riding a stationary bike, whether upright or recumbent, is an excellent cardio exercise for beginners with little risk of injury. Start with just 10-15 minutes a few times a week and build up slowly.

• Light jogging - Once you've built up your endurance through walking and strength, you can try jogging for short periods. Start with just 30 seconds to 1 minute of jogging alternating with walking. Repeat for 15-20 minutes total. Gradually make the jogging intervals longer as your endurance improves.

The key for beginners is to start slowly, focus on moderate exercise, use proper form, stay hydrated and have fun! Build up your endurance and strength over time as your fitness improves.

instruction: Do you know why turkeys became the official food of thanksgiving?
output:
There are a few reasons why turkeys became strongly associated with Thanksgiving in the U.S.:

1. Turkeys are native to North America, so they were readily available to early American settlers. They were a good source of meat protein for the celebratory harvest meal.

2. Turkeys were hunted by Native Americans, so the early settlers adopted the tradition. Some accounts of early Thanksgiving feasts with the Native Americans mention that turkeys were consumed.

3. Turkeys have become a symbol of abundance and prosperity. Serving a big turkey signifies a successful harvest and plenty of food to go around.

4. The turkey tradition was popularized by 19th century magazines, cookbooks, and Abraham Lincoln. Magazines featured recipes for roast turkey, Lincoln proclaimed Thanksgiving a national holiday in 1863, and featured turkey in his Thanksgiving proclamation.

5. The turkey tradition solidified in the early 20th century. As Thanksgiving became more popular and commercialized, turkey became the standard main dish for the Thanksgiving meal. This was helped by turkey farmers who promoted turkey for Thanksgiving.

6. Norman Rockwell's illustrations featured a turkey in his famous 1943 painting "Freedom from Want". This helped cement the tradition in popular culture.

So in summary, the turkey's history and place in American culture, its symbolism of abundance, and its promotion in media and advertising led to its strong association as the official food of Thanksgiving. This tradition really took hold by the early 20th century and remains popular to this day.

instruction: I want to get better at networking at work
output:
Here are some tips to improve your networking at work:

• Build genuine connections. Don't network just for the sake of networking. Connect with people you genuinely find interesting and would like to get to know better. People can tell if you have a hidden agenda.

• Focus on listening. Ask open-ended questions to show you are interested in learning more about them. People love to talk about themselves, so give them the opportunity to do so. Pay attention and listen for areas of common interest or potential ways to help each other.

• Offer to help others. Helping coworkers is a great way to build goodwill and strengthen your working relationships. Look for opportunities to offer assistance to others in a sincere and meaningful way. But don't be pushy about it.

• Attend work events. Make an appearance at as many work-related social events as possible, like office parties, networking events, happy hours, etc. These types of gatherings are a chance to connect with coworkers in a more casual setting. But don't overdo it, especially if there is alcohol involved.

• Build connections beyond your immediate team. Get to know people in other departments and teams. The wider your professional network, the more opportunities may open up for you in the future.

• Stay in regular contact. Once you have made a connection with someone, stay in touch with them regularly through quick emails, coffee breaks, or short drop-ins. But don't pester them if they seem too busy. Look for the right opportunities to reconnect.

• Share information and resources. If you come across information or resources that could benefit others in your network, pass it along to them. They will likely appreciate your thoughtfulness in thinking of them, and it helps to strengthen your connection.

• Consider a mentor. Look for a mentor at work, someone you admire and who can provide guidance to help you improve your networking and career. A good mentor can make a big difference in your professional growth.

instruction: Are there any weird Christmas traditions?
output:
Yes, there are some unusual Christmas traditions around the world:

• In Norway, people hide their brooms on Christmas Eve. There is a belief that witches and evil spirits come out on Christmas Eve, so hiding the brooms prevents them from borrowing them for riding.

• In Ukraine, people decorate Christmas trees with fake spiders and webs. There is a legend that a poor family couldn't afford decorations for their tree, so the spiders in the house spun webs to make it look beautiful.

• In Japan, people eat KFC for Christmas dinner. Eating fried chicken has become a very popular tradition on Christmas Eve. People place orders weeks in advance to get their "Kentucky Christmas dinner."

• In Catalonia, Spain, people create little Christmas logs that "defecate" gifts. People hollow out logs, fill them with gifts, and have children beat them with sticks until the gifts fall out. It's meant to make defecating gifts fun for kids.

• In Norway, male members of the family dress up as goats made of straw and wander the streets. They visit friends and family, dancing and acting like goats. It's meant to drive away evil spirits.

• In Germany, people drop molten lead into cold water on Christmas Eve. The shapes formed by the lead are said to predict what the new year will bring. Certain shapes represent travel, money, luck, etc.

• In Venezuela, people roller skate to church for Christmas mass. Roads are closed to cars so people can skate to church services, sometimes covering over 12 miles.

• In the Czech Republic, people save one fish scale for each member of the family. On Christmas Eve, the family places the scales under the tablecloth for dinner. If a scale curls up, it means that person will die within the year. Morbid but an old tradition!

instruction: Hi, I'm interested in learning to play badminton. Can you explain the game to me?
output:
Sure, here's a quick overview of badminton:

• Badminton is a racquet sport played by two opposing players (or two opposing pairs in doubles).

• The objective is to hit a shuttlecock back and forth over a high net, without letting it hit the ground.

• Players use rackets to hit the shuttlecock. The racket has a handle and an oval head with tightly strung strings.

• The shuttlecock is a feathered projectile that weighs very little. Players hit it back and forth over the net until someone misses and lets it drop.

• A badminton court is rectangular, with the net in the middle. Players can hit the shuttlecock off the net, as long as it goes over to the other side.

• Players can hit the shuttlecock off the walls/ceilings, if any. It can bounce once on each side. No double bounces.

• Standard games are best 2 out of 3 sets, with each set played to 21 points. You must win by at least 2 points.

• Key techniques are the overhead clear/smash, drop shot, and serves. The clear is a high lob, the smash is a powerful downward hit, and drop shots just go over the net.

• Serves start each point. The shuttlecock must go diagonally over the net. Only the server can score on a serve.

• Basic equipment includes rackets, shuttlecocks, comfortable sports clothes, and proper shoes for traction.

• The most important skills are hand-eye coordination and quick reflexes. Badminton can be a fast-paced game!

Let me know if you have any other questions. Have fun and good luck learning badminton!

instruction: Do you know why cats always rub up against your legs?
output:
There are a few reasons why cats rub up against people's legs:

• Marking their territory. Cats have scent glands on their face and paws, and rubbing against people is a way for them to mark you as their territory by leaving their scent on you.

• Affection. Rubbing against you is a way for cats to show you affection and bond with you. Cats that are well socialized and bonded with their owners will frequently rub against them.

• Attention seeking. Some cats learn that rubbing against their owners will elicit attention, petting, and scratches from them. So they do it as a way to get attention and interaction with you.

• Scent mingling. Cats have a strong sense of smell, and they recognize people and other animals by scent. Rubbing against you allows a cat to mingle their scent with yours, which makes them feel content and comfortable with you.

• Instinct. Some cats will rub against table legs, doorways, and other stationary objects in their environment. This is due to an instinct to mark objects in their space with their scent. When they do it to people, it's usually a sign of affection and bonding, but instinct does play a role.

• Anxiety relief. Some cats are prone to anxiety and rubbing against their owners helps to relieve that anxiety by spreading a familiar and calming scent, and by gaining attention and affection from the person they feel closest to.

So in summary, cats rub up against people primarily as a way to show affection, bond, mark their territory, and relieve anxiety. But getting attention and satisfying their instinct to spread their scent are also motivators for many cats.

instruction: I am going to try to roast a pig at home for Thanksgiving this year. What equipment and techniques do I need to successfully get a pig roasted?
output:
Roasting a whole pig at home requires some special equipment and technique:

• A pig roaster or spit - You'll need a way to roast the pig over an open flame or coals. You can use a pig roaster, which is a metal cage that holds the pig, or construct a spit to pierce and suspend the pig over the fire.

• Fuel - You'll need a heat source like charcoal, wood, or propane to roast the pig. Charcoal or wood will provide the most authentic smoky flavor.

• A drip pan - Place a large pan under the pig to catch the drippings and fat that will render out during cooking.

• Turning mechanism - If using a spit, you'll need a way to turn it so the pig roasts evenly on all sides. A hand crank or motorized spit turner works well.

• Pig - A smaller pig, around 50-100 lbs, works best for home roasting. Ask your butcher to prepare and clean the pig for roasting.

• Seasoning - Season the pig all over with salt, pepper, and the spices of your choice. You can also place halved onions, lemons, and herbs inside the cavity for extra flavor.

• Basting - Baste the pig frequently while roasting using the drippings, melted butter, and/or your favorite barbecue mop or sauce.

• Slow roasting - Roast the pig over low, indirect heat, about 225 F. The total roasting time will be 6-8 hours for a 50-100 lb pig.

• Check internal temperature - The pig is done when the thickest part of the thigh reaches 195-205 F.

• Resting - Let the pig rest for 20-30 minutes before carving and serving. Enjoy your roast pig! The crispy skin and juicy meat will be worth the effort.

Let me know if you have any other questions! Roasting a whole pig can be challenging but also rewarding. Good luck!

instruction: Help me find a good rated electric saw.
output:
Here are some highly rated electric saw options:

• Dewalt DW745 Compact Job Site Table Saw - This is a very popular portable table saw that is compact and lightweight but still powerful. It has a 15 amp motor and can cut through hardwoods and even pressure treated lumber. It gets very good reviews and is a great all-purpose table saw for DIY and small workshop use.

• Bosch 4100-09 10-Inch Worksite Table Saw - This is another excellent portable table saw option from Bosch. It has a powerful 15 amp motor, can make cuts up to 3-1/8 inches deep, and has a pneumatic wheel system for easy transport. It gets outstanding reviews for its power, accuracy, and portability.

• Makita 2705 10-Inch Contractor Table Saw - For a little more heavy duty use, the Makita 2705 is a great contractor-style table saw. It has a 15 amp motor, a larger table surface, and can rip 4x8 plywood sheets. It still has wheels for portability but is more suited for a contractor or home DIY work. It gets very good reviews and is highly rated. 

• DeWalt DCS7485B FLEXVOLT 8-1/4-Inch Table Saw - For the ultimate in power and portability, the DeWalt Flexvolt table saw is a great choice. It runs on a 60V battery but has the power of a corded saw. It can make cuts up to 2-1/4 inches thick and has an 8-1/4 inch blade. The rack and pinion fence system provides fast, accurate cuts. It's ideal if you need a lot of flexibility and portability. Reviews say it has incredible power and performance for a cordless saw.

• SKILSAW SPT70WT-01 15-Amp 10-Inch Portable Worm Drive Table Saw - For ripping thick, hardwoods, the SKILSAW SPT70WT is an excellent choice. It has a 15 amp dual-field motor that delivers 5300 RPM and power to rip cut lumber up to 3-1/2 inches thick. The solid cast aluminum table provides a stable work surface. This is a well-built, powerful saw ideal for construction work and gets very good reviews.

Does any of these sound good? Let me know if you have any other questions.

instruction: What are some artists I might like if I like Billy Joel?
output:
Here are some artists similar to Billy Joel that you might enjoy:

• Elton John - Also a classic pop/rock singer, pianist and songwriter known for timeless songs like “Rocket Man,” “Tiny Dancer” and “Your Song.”

• Paul Simon - A iconic singer/songwriter known for creative, lyrical songs with a pop/rock sound like “Bridge Over Troubled Water,” “The Sound of Silence” and “Graceland.”

• James Taylor - A pioneer of the singer/songwriter genre with a melodic pop/rock style and hits like “Fire and Rain,” “Shower the People” and “Sweet Baby James.”

• Bob Seger - A heartland rock artist known for hits like “Night Moves,” “Against the Wind” and “Rock and Roll Never Forgets.” Similar classic, melodic style to Billy Joel.

instruction: What type of soil is suitable for cactus?
output:
Cacti generally prefer loose, fast-draining soils. Some good options for cactus soil include:

• Commercial cactus potting mix - These mixes are readily available and formulated specifically for cacti and succulents. They contain inorganic materials like perlite or pumice to improve drainage.

• Regular potting soil mixed with perlite - You can make your own cactus potting mix by mixing 2 parts regular potting soil with 1 part perlite. Perlite is a lightweight, porous rock that helps improve drainage and aeration.

• Coarse sand mixed with potting soil - A mix of 2 parts coarse sand and 1 part potting soil also works well for cacti. The sand provides drainage and grittiness.

• Gravel or crushed rock - For some cacti, especially desert cacti, a gravelly mix may be suitable. Use 3 parts crushed rock or gravel to 1 part potting soil.

• Coco coir - Coco coir is the shredded fiber from coconut husks. It holds moisture while still being airy and fast-draining. Mix 3 parts coco coir to 1 part perlite for cactus soil.

In general, a suitable cactus potting mix should be loose, porous, and free-draining. It should not remain soggy, as too much moisture can cause root rot in cacti. Most cacti do not require a nutrient-rich soil, so a basic mix is fine for most home growers. The ideal pH for cactus soil is slightly acidic to neutral, between 6 and 7.

Does this help explain the suitable soil types for cacti? Let me know if you have any other questions.

instruction: How do you become an author?
output:
Here are some steps to become an author:

1. Develop your writing skills. Becoming an author requires strong writing and communication skills. Practice writing regularly to improve your writing. You can start by writing short stories, blog posts, or journal entries. Get feedback from others to help strengthen your writing.

2. Choose your genre. Decide what type of book you want to write, such as fiction, nonfiction, romance, mystery, etc. Study the conventions and styles of your chosen genre. Read other books in that genre to get a feel for the language and themes.

3. Create an outline. Develop an outline that lays out your plot, characters, chapter sequences, and key events. Figure out your beginning, rising action, climax, falling action, and resolution. For nonfiction, determine your angles, arguments, evidence, and key points. An outline will help give you direction before you start writing.

4. Establish a regular writing schedule. Set aside time each day to write and stick to it. Aim for at least 30 to 60 minutes a day of dedicated writing time. Turn off distractions and write in a quiet, secluded place. Start early and stop at a point where you still have more to say. That will make it easy to start again the next day.

5. Edit and proofread thoroughly. Refine and tighten your writing by editing your manuscript and proofreading carefully. Get feedback from other writers or editors. Make sure your book is coherent, compelling, and technically sound before publishing.

6. Publish your book. Research literary agents and publishing companies that publish the genre of book you've written. Submit query letters to agents who may be interested in representing your work. Be prepared for rejection and perseverance. Consider self-publishing as an ebook or in print. Market your book through social media, author events, and other promotions.

7. Continue writing and improving. Write more books to build your credibility and skill. Stay active in the writing community by networking with other authors, taking additional writing courses, and keeping abreast of trends in the publishing industry. Success as an author takes dedication and continuous learning.

instruction: What breed dog is smallest?
output:
Some of the smallest dog breeds are:

• Chihuahua - The Chihuahua is the smallest dog breed by height. An adult Chihuahua weighs 3 to 6 pounds.

• Yorkshire Terrier - The Yorkie is one of the smallest dog breeds by weight. A fully grown Yorkie weighs 7 pounds or less.

• Pomeranian - The Pomeranian is a very small fluffy dog that weighs between 3 to 7 pounds as an adult.

• Maltese - The Maltese is a small companion dog that weighs between 4 to 7 pounds fully grown.

• Shih Tzu - The Shih Tzu is a small breed that weighs between 9 to 16 pounds as an adult.

• Pug - Pugs are small dogs that weigh between 14 to 18 pounds fully grown.

• French Bulldog - The French Bulldog is a small breed of bulldog that weighs up to 28 pounds as an adult.

• Cavalier King Charles Spaniel - The Cavalier King Charles Spaniel is a small spaniel breed that weighs between 13 to 18 pounds fully grown.

• Boston Terrier - The Boston Terrier is a small breed that weighs 15 to 25 pounds as an adult.

• Lhasa Apso - The Lhasa Apso is a small Tibetan breed that weighs 12 to 15 pounds fully grown.

As you can see, there are many tiny and small dog breeds to choose from. In general, most dogs under 20 pounds full grown can be considered quite small. But some breeds like the Chihuahua and Yorkie are exceptionally tiny. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: What are some species of bears that are now extinct?
output:
Some extinct bear species include:

• Cave bears (Ursus spelaeus) - Went extinct about 24,000 years ago. They were large bears that lived in Europe and Asia.

• Florida cave bears (Ursus martinus) - Extinct about 11,000 years ago. They were found in Florida and parts of the southeastern US.

• European brown bears (Ursus arctos) - The populations of several subspecies went extinct in historical times due to hunting and habitat loss. These include the Atlas bear of Africa and the Marsican brown bear of central Italy.

• Syrian brown bears (Ursus arctos syriacus) - Went extinct in the 20th century. They were found in the Middle East.

• Mexican grizzly bears (Ursus arctos nelsoni) - Went extinct in the 1960s. They were found in Mexico.

• Japanese bears (Ursus thibetanus japonicus) - Went extinct during the Meiji era in Japan, around the late 19th century. They were native to the Japanese islands of Honshu and Shikoku.

• Gobi bears (Ursus pruinosus) - Went extinct in the 1970s. They were found in the Gobi desert of Mongolia and parts of northern China.

• Blue bears (Ursus arctos middendorffi) - An ancient polar bear lineage that went extinct about 8,000 years ago. Remains have been found on islands in the Arctic archipelago of Svalbard.

So there were many species and subspecies of bears that roamed various parts of Europe, Asia, North America and even Africa that have now sadly gone extinct. Most went extinct due to hunting, loss of habitat and loss of prey.

instruction: What causes the northern lights?
output:
The northern lights, also known as the aurora borealis, are caused by the interaction of particles from the sun with the upper atmosphere near the North Pole. Here's how it works:

1. The sun constantly emits particles, including protons and electrons, as part of the solar wind. When there are disturbances on the sun, such as solar flares, it can release larger bursts of particles.

2. These particles from the sun travel outward into space at very high speeds. Some of them eventually collide with and enter the Earth's upper atmosphere, especially near the magnetic poles.

3. The particles interact with gases in the atmosphere, like nitrogen and oxygen. This interaction releases energy in the form of light, which we see as the colorful displays of the northern and southern lights.

4. The specific colors that we observe depend on which gases the particles interact with. Interactions with oxygen typically produce green and red light. Nitrogen produces blue and purple light.

5. The location of the lights depends on the magnetic field lines of the Earth, which guide the particles into the upper atmosphere near the poles. So the northern lights are usually only seen at high latitudes, within the Arctic and Antarctic circles.

6. The intensity and location of the northern lights can vary based on the level of solar activity and geomagnetic storms. More active space weather means a higher chance of seeing the lights at lower latitudes.

So in summary, the northern lights are caused by particles from the sun interacting with gases in the Earth's upper atmosphere, especially near the magnetic poles. The specific colors and location of the lights depend on which gases are involved and the intensity of the solar activity.

instruction: What are some good foods to eat when you are sick? I am looking for something to make my girlfriend to eat.
output:
Here are some good foods to eat when sick:

• Broth-based soups: Chicken soup, bone broth, etc. Soups help keep you hydrated while also providing nutrients. The warm, liquid food can be soothing for a sore throat.

• Bananas: Bananas are easy to digest and provide potassium, fiber and other nutrients. They can help with diarrhea and upset stomach.

• Rice and oatmeal: Plain rice, rice porridge and oatmeal are bland, starchy foods that can help settle the stomach. They provide calories and nutrients.

• Toast: Plain toast, especially whole wheat toast, provides nutrients and calories. The bland food is easy on the stomach.

• Ginger: Ginger can help reduce inflammation in the gut and ease nausea. You can take ginger capsules, or add ginger to foods like soups, smoothies, and tea.

• Probiotic yogurt: Yogurt with live active cultures provides good bacteria for the gut. It can help with digestive issues and boost immunity. Look for plain yogurt with no added sugar.

• Broths: In addition to soups, plain broths such as chicken, beef and bone broth provide hydration, electrolytes and nutrients.

• Herbal tea: Teas such as chamomile, peppermint, licorice and fennel tea have soothing and digestive properties. The warm tea also keeps you hydrated.

• Avocado: Ripe mashed avocado provides healthy fats, fiber, vitamins and minerals. It has a mild flavor and creamy texture, which is good when sick.

• Eggs: Eggs are a perfect sick day food. They provide protein, zinc, vitamin D, riboflavin and other nutrients. Poached or scrambled eggs are gentle options.

I hope your girlfriend feels better soon. Let me know if you have any other questions.

instruction: Why is kobe beef so damn expensive?
output:
Kobe beef is expensive for several reasons:

1. It comes from a special breed of cattle called Japanese Black, which is bred specifically to produce high quality, marbled beef. These cattle require special care and their breeding is tightly controlled. This limited supply drives the high price.

2. Kobe beef comes from Hyogo Prefecture in Japan, and meat that is exported is very limited. Most Kobe beef cannot be exported and is consumed domestically in Japan. This also contributes to the limited supply and high price.

3. Kobe beef is highly prized for its superior marbling and flavor. It has a high percentage of fat marbling in the meat, which gives it a rich buttery texture. This premium quality and taste also allows it to command a premium price.

4. Kobe beef goes through a stringent grading system based on standards for marbling, color, texture, and quality. Only the top grades are sold as authentic Kobe beef. This high standard and limited grades also drive the price up.

5. There is a lot of demand worldwide for authentic top-grade Kobe beef. It is considered a delicacy and status symbol by many. High demand and limited supply inevitably mean a high price tag.

6. There are a lot of counterfeit Kobe beef products, but authentic certified Kobe beef has strict regulations. It must come from Hyogo Prefecture, be a particular strain of Japanese Black cattle, and meet certain grading standards. This certification process also adds to the overall cost.

In summary, the premium quality, limited supply, high demand, and strict standards for authenticity all contribute to Kobe beef being one of the most prized and expensive beef products in the world. For many, its unparalleled taste and tenderness make it worth the high price. But for most consumers, it remains an infrequent indulgence and status treat.

instruction: How do I clean my armpits?
output:
Here are some tips for cleaning your armpits:

• Shower regularly using warm water and a mild cleanser. Showering helps wash away dead skin cells, sweat, deodorant residue and bacteria from your armpits. Showering 2-3 times a week is a good target for most people.

• Exfoliate your armpits occasionally. Use a washcloth, scrub, or chemical exfoliant like glycolic acid to remove dead skin cells. This will help prevent ingrown hairs and make your deodorant more effective. But don't exfoliate too often, 1-2 times a week at most.

• Apply deodorant or antiperspirant after showering. This helps prevent body odor and sweating during the day. Look for a product that contains aluminum salts like aluminum chloride, aluminum chlorohydrate or aluminum zirconium.

• Alternate between deodorant and antiperspirant. Antiperspirants prevent sweating, while deodorants prevent body odor. Using only antiperspirants for a long time can block sweat glands, so alternating is a good idea.

• Consider using natural deodorants. If you have sensitive skin or want to avoid certain chemicals, natural deodorants containing ingredients like baking soda, coconut oil, shea butter and essential oils can work well for many people. You may need to reapply more often.

• See a dermatologist for prescription antiperspirant. If over-the-counter products aren't working well enough, a dermatologist can prescribe clinical strength antiperspirants containing up to 20% aluminum salts to prevent excessive armpit sweating.

• For dark armpits, use a lightening cream. If your armpits are darker than the surrounding skin, a product containing hydroquinone, kojic acid, azelaic acid or vitamin C can help lighten the area over time. But always do a patch test first to check for irritation.

• In severe cases, consider laser hair removal or Botox injections. For persistent issues with body odor, sweating or ingrown hairs, laser hair removal or Botox treatment of the armpits may provide more long-lasting solutions. But these procedures can be expensive, so try other options first.

instruction: How do I detail a car?
output:
Here are some steps to detail a car:

1. Wash the car thoroughly. Wash the car from top to bottom using car wash soap and water. Use a sponge or mitt to remove any dirt or debris. Pay extra attention to wheel wells and door jambs. Rinse well with water.

2. Dry the car. Use microfiber towels to dry the entire car, including door jambs and wheel wells. Make sure all water is wiped away to avoid water spots.

3. Clean the wheels and tires. Apply wheel cleaner to the wheels and tires. Let it sit, then scrub off with a wheel brush. Rinse and dry completely.

4. Clean the windows inside and out. Use glass cleaner and paper towels or microfiber cloths to clean the windshield and all windows inside and out. Vacuum the seats and carpeting.

5. Apply tire dressing. Apply tire shine or dressing to the tires to restore the deep black finish. Wipe off any excess with a towel.

6. Vacuum the seats and carpets. Use a vacuum with appropriate attachments to vacuum seats, carpeting, door panels and any other upholstered areas of the interior.

7. Wipe down vinyl and plastic. Use a protectant or multi-surface wipes to clean vinyl door panels, the dashboard, center console and any plastic trim. Apply protectant to condition the surfaces.

8. Apply leather conditioner. If the car has leather seats, apply a leather conditioner as directed to moisturize and protect the leather.

9. Apply wax or polish. Apply wax, polish or paint sealant to the car's paint as directed. Use a buffer to remove any imperfections and make the paint shine. Remove any remaining residue with a microfiber cloth.

10. Air out the interior. Drive the car with the windows down to ventilate the interior and remove any chemical smells from the cleaning products. Your detailed car will now look showroom new!

instruction: I am going to make pumpkin pie for the first time.  Can you help me?
output:
Absolutely, here are some tips for making pumpkin pie:

1. Use fresh pumpkin puree or canned pumpkin puree. Canned puree is easier but fresh pumpkin puree will give you a more vibrant flavor. To make fresh puree, cut a small sugar pumpkin in half, scoop out the seeds, place cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast at 350 F until soft, about 45-60 minutes. Let cool, then scoop out the flesh and puree.

2. Use a flaky pie crust. A homemade pie crust or store-bought crust made with butter or shortening will give you the classic flaky texture. Roll out the dough and place in a 9-inch pie pan.

3. Add spices like cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and cloves. The typical spices for pumpkin pie are cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and cloves. You'll want about 1 to 2 teaspoons of cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon of ginger, 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg and a pinch of cloves. You can adjust the spices to your own taste.

4. Use evaporated milk or sweetened condensed milk. Evaporated milk or sweetened condensed milk help give pumpkin pie its creamy texture. Use about 1 (12 ounce) can of evaporated milk or 1 (14 ounce) can of sweetened condensed milk.

5. Add eggs. Eggs help bind all the ingredients together and give the pie its custardy structure. Use 2-3 eggs, whisked until well blended.

6. Add sugar to taste. Start with about 3/4 to 1 cup of sugar, and add more to taste depending on how sweet you want the pie.

7. Pour into the pie crust and bake. Pour the pumpkin mixture into the pie crust and bake in a 425 F preheated oven for 15 minutes, then reduce the temperature to 350 F and bake about 40-50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

8. Allow to cool before serving. Cool the pie for at least 2 hours before serving to allow it to set. Top with whipped cream or whipped topping if desired. Enjoy! Let me know if you have any other questions.

instruction: What kind of foods do they eat in Thailand
output:
Thailand is known for its delicious food. Some popular Thai foods include:

• Rice - Thailand is the world's largest exporter of rice. Rice is a staple part of almost every Thai meal.

• Noodles - Thai noodles come in many varieties, the most popular being Pad Thai (stir-fried rice noodles with egg, tofu, shrimp or chicken and peanuts) and Tom Yum soup (spicy and sour soup with mushrooms, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, chillies and meat or seafood).

• Curries - Thai curries come in many varieties, the most popular being green curry, red curry, massaman curry and panang curry. Thai curries are usually made with coconut milk and fresh herbs and spices.

• Soups - In addition to Tom Yum soup, popular soups include Tom Kha soup (coconut soup with mushrooms, galangal and chicken or seafood) and boat noodle soup.

• Satay - Grilled meat skewers served with a spicy peanut sauce. Chicken, beef and pork satays are popular.

• Spring Rolls - Minced meat, vegetables and noodles wrapped in pastry skin and deep fried. Usually served with a chili sauce.

• Som Tam (Papaya Salad) - Shredded papaya mixed with chili, lime juice, tomatoes, peanuts and palm sugar. A very popular spicy and tangy salad.

• Larb - Minced meat salad with herbs, lime juice, chili, mint and toasted rice. Usually made with chicken, pork, duck or fish.

• Fresh Fruits - Thailand is known for fresh tropical fruits like mangoes, rambutans, mangosteens, dragon fruits, pineapples, coconuts, etc.

• Desserts - Popular sweets include mango with sticky rice, custard filled roti, coconut pudding, etc.

That covers some of the most popular and well-known Thai foods. Thai cuisine has a wonderful blend of flavors, spices and aromas. No wonder it is one of the most popular cuisines in the world.

instruction: What are some good browser alternatives to Chrome?
output:
Here are some good alternative browsers to Chrome:

• Firefox - Open source browser from Mozilla. It's privacy-focused and has a large selection of extensions. It's available for Windows, Mac, Linux, Android and iOS.

• Microsoft Edge - Microsoft's latest browser that comes built-in with Windows 10. It's light, simple and integrates well with other Microsoft services. It has versions for Windows, Mac, Android and iOS.

• Brave - Open source browser that focuses on privacy and blocking ads and trackers. It's built on Chromium and available for Windows, Mac, Linux, Android and iOS.

• Safari - Native browser for Macs and iOS devices from Apple. It's designed to be minimal and battery efficient. Only available for Mac and iOS. 

• Opera - Feature-rich browser that includes a built-in ad blocker, free VPN, WhatsApp and Facebook Messenger integration. It's available for Windows, Mac, Linux, Android and iOS.

• Vivaldi - Browser aimed at power users who want lots of customization features. Includes tab stacking, notes, and interface themes. Available for Windows, Mac, Linux, Android.

• Tor Browser - Privacy-focused browser from the Tor Project. It hides your identity and location and is designed for anonymous web browsing. Available for Windows, Mac, Linux, Android.

• DuckDuckGo - Private search browser that doesn't track you or store your personal information. It's open source and available as mobile apps only for Android and iOS.

So there are quite a few good, free alternatives to Chrome depending on your needs and preferences. Let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: Who created the Superman cartoon character?
output:
Superman was created by writer Jerry Siegel and artist Joe Shuster in 1933. Superman first appeared in Action Comics #1, published in 1938.

The Superman cartoon character appeared in various animated shorts and TV shows over the years. Some of the most well-known ones include:

• The Superman animated shorts produced by Fleischer Studios and Famous Studios from 1941 to 1943. These were very influential on later animated and TV depictions of Superman.

• The Super Friends animated series produced by Hanna-Barbera from 1973 to 1986. This featured Superman along with various other DC superheroes like Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, etc.

• Superman: The Animated Series which aired from 1996 to 2000. This animated show produced by Warner Bros. Animation adapted many of the classic Superman stories and characters for the small screen.

• The New Superman Adventures which aired from 1997 to 1999. This was a continuation of Superman: The Animated Series using the same animation style.

So while Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster created the original Superman comic book character, many animation studios, animators, directors and producers were involved in bringing the Superman cartoon character to animated life over many decades. But they were all building upon the foundation established by Siegel and Shuster.

instruction: What is Atlantis?
output:
Atlantis is a legendary ancient city that was first mentioned by the Greek philosopher Plato in his dialogues Timaeus and Critias, written around 360 BC. According to Plato, Atlantis was a powerful and advanced kingdom that sank into the ocean around 9,600 BC.

Plato described Atlantis as an island empire in the Atlantic Ocean, west of the Strait of Gibraltar. The stories of Atlantis's demise refer to a catastrophic event where the island was submerged into the ocean. According to Plato, the gods became angry with Atlantis and submerged the entire island into the ocean in a single day and night.

Most historians believe that Atlantis was either completely mythical or loosely based on a historical society. However, some people believe Atlantis was a real historical kingdom that was technologically advanced and sank into the ocean. The location of Atlantis is unknown and there are various proposed sites, though none have been conclusively proven. The legends of Atlantis have captured people's imaginations for centuries and inspired many books, movies, and documentaries.

The key aspects of the Atlantis legend are:

• Atlantis was a powerful and advanced kingdom that sank into the ocean around 9,600 BC.

• Atlantis was described by Plato as an island empire in the Atlantic Ocean.

• The gods submerged Atlantis into the ocean in a catastrophic event.

• The location of Atlantis is unknown and debated, though most historians believe it was either mythical or loosely based on a real society.

• Atlantis has inspired many books, movies, and documentaries and captured public interest for centuries.

That's the overview of what Atlantis is according to legend and Plato's accounts. Please let me know if you have any other questions!

instruction: How do I make escargot?
output:
Here are the steps to make escargot:

1. Obtain fresh snails. You want to get edible land snails, such as Helix pomatia, that have been purged of any toxins. Check with your local specialty food stores or butcher shops to source the snails.

2. Purge the snails. Place the snails in a mesh bag or perforated container and rinse them under cold running water for several hours to purge them of any toxins or impurities. Change the water frequently.

3. Blanch the snails. Bring a pot of water to a boil, then plunge the snails into the boiling water for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove and rinse with cold water. This will help loosen the snail meat from the shell.

4. Remove the snail meat from the shells. Use tongs or a toothpick to extract the snail meat from the shells. Rinse the snail meat again under cold water.

5. Make a garlic butter. Mix 3/4 cup softened butter with 3 to 4 minced garlic cloves, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, salt, and pepper.

6. Stuff the snail shells. Use a spoon or piping bag to fill each snail shell with the garlic butter.

7. Bake the escargot. Place the stuffed snail shells in a baking dish and bake at 400 F for 10 to 15 minutes until the butter is bubbly.

8. Serve. Serve the escargot piping hot with bread to soak up the garlic butter. Provide small forks or tongs for extracting the snail meat from the shells.

9. Optional: garnish with parsley and paprika for extra flavor and color. Enjoy your escargot! The key is not to overcook the snails or they can become tough. Bon appetit!

instruction: What exactly causes volcanoes to form?
output:
Volcanoes form when magma from below the Earth's surface erupts onto the surface. There are several factors that can cause the formation of volcanoes:

1. Tectonic plate movements: The most common cause of volcano formation is the movement of tectonic plates. When tectonic plates collide or move apart from each other, they can allow magma from the mantle to rise to the surface, which results in volcanic eruptions and volcano formation. For example, the Ring of Fire around the Pacific ocean is formed due to the collision of oceanic plates with continental plates.

2. Hotspots: Volcanoes can also form over hotspots, which are plumes of hot magma rising from deep within the mantle. The magma from the hotspot melts through the crust and results in volcanic eruptions on the surface. The Hawaiian islands were formed over a hotspot in the middle of the Pacific plate.

3. Fault lines and cracks: Pre-existing faults, cracks, and weaknesses in the crust can act as channels for magma to rise to the surface. When magma forces its way up through these cracks, it can erupt as volcanoes at the surface.

4. Mantle plumes: Large plumes of hot rock, called mantle plumes, can rise from the lower mantle and cause massive volcanic eruptions and the formation of volcanoes. The Deccan traps and Siberian traps were formed by huge mantle plume eruptions.

5. Subduction zones: When two plates collide and one plate is forced below the other into the mantle (called subduction), the rocks melt into magma and rise to the surface, resulting in volcanoes. The Cascade Range of North America is formed by subduction of the Juan de Fuca plate below the North American plate.

So in summary, movements of tectonic plates, hotspots, pre-existing faults, mantle plumes, and subduction are the major geological mechanisms that cause magma to rise to the surface and lead to volcano formation.

instruction: Hi, I have some falafel, but no tahini to put on them. Can you give me a recipe for making tahini?
output:
Sure, here is a simple recipe for homemade tahini:

Ingredients:

• 1 pound raw sesame seeds

• 1/2 teaspoon salt (optional)

• Neutral-flavored oil (optional)

Instructions:

1. Pour the sesame seeds into a dry skillet over medium-low heat. Toast the seeds, stirring frequently, until they are fragrant and turn a shade darker, about 5 to 7 minutes.

2. Transfer the toasted seeds to a bowl and let cool for a few minutes.

3. Pour the cooled seeds into a food processor. Process the seeds for several minutes, scraping down the sides as needed, until they release their oils and turn into a paste. This can take up to 10 minutes total.

4. Add the salt (if using) and 1-2 tablespoons of neutral oil (if using) and process until well combined.

5. Transfer the tahini to an airtight container. Store refrigerated for up to 6 months.

6. Before using, stir the tahini well as the oils may separate during storage. Add more salt to taste if needed.

7. Use the tahini as a spread for your falafel, or add it to salad dressings, hummus, and other Middle Eastern dishes.

Some tips:

• For a thinner tahini, use more oil. For a thicker paste, use less oil.

• Toast the sesame seeds for more nutty flavor. But be careful not to burn them.

• Adding oil to the tahini is optional. It will produce a looser, pourable tahini. Without oil, the tahini will be quite thick.

• Salt is optional and added to taste. You can always add it when using the tahini in recipes.

• Raw tahini will last longer, up to a year. Toasted tahini has more flavor but will last 3-6 months.

Enjoy your falafel with the homemade tahini! Let me know if you have any other questions.

instruction: Should I get my children a nanny? I'm so exhausted.
output:
Getting a nanny is a big decision that depends on several factors:

• Your budget. Nannies can be expensive, often $15-30/hour or more for a full-time nanny. Can you afford the ongoing cost?

• Your children's ages and needs. A nanny may be more helpful when you have young children or children with special needs who require more care and attention. For school-age kids, a part-time nanny or babysitter may be sufficient.

• Your own needs and schedule. If you work long or irregular hours, travel frequently, or just feel overwhelmed, a nanny can provide stability and help ensure your kids' needs are met.

• Your parenting preferences. Do you want your kids primarily cared for by family or prefer more independence? A nanny provides more consistent care whereas other options like daycare or preschool also provide social interaction and independence.

• Available alternatives. Consider other options like daycare, preschool, after-school programs, babysitters, or relying on family members for childcare. Which options best suit your needs?

• Your living situation. Live-in nannies provide maximum flexibility but require extra space. A live-out nanny or other options may be better if you lack space.

• Ability to supervise and evaluate. Make sure you have the time and ability to properly screen, interview, hire, and evaluate a nanny's performance. Providing ongoing feedback and supervision is important.

If after considering these factors you think a nanny could help provide the care and support you need, start by determining if you want full-time, part-time, live-in or live-out help. Then begin the search and interview process. Checking references and doing background checks is critical to finding a responsible nanny. With the right person, a nanny can be a great solution. But make sure to start with a trial period in case it's not the right match.

instruction: When was Canada colonized?
output:
Canada was colonized by Europeans in stages starting in the late 15th century:

• The first European explorers to reach present-day Canada were the Vikings around 1000 AD, but they did not establish any permanent settlements.

• The first European explorers seeking trade routes to Asia, including John Cabot in 1497 and Jacques Cartier in 1534, claimed parts of Canada for European kingdoms.

• The first permanent European settlements were established in the early 17th century:

› Port Royal was founded in 1605 by French colonists. It was the first permanent European settlement in present-day Canada.

› Quebec City was founded by Samuel de Champlain in 1608, also by French colonists.

› The British established their first permanent settlement at Cuper's Cove, Newfoundland in 1610.

• Over the next centuries, the British and the French expanded their settlements, establishing colonies in what is now Ontario, Quebec, Nova Scotia, etc. They fought many wars over control of lands in North America.

• Britain gained control of most of France's colonies in North America by the 1763 Treaty of Paris at the end of the Seven Years' War.

• The British colonies gained independence in 1867 and formed the Dominion of Canada, a self-governing dominion of the British Empire.

• Canada gained full political independence from the United Kingdom in 1931 with the Statute of Westminster. But Queen Elizabeth II remained the ceremonial head of state until 1982.

So in summary, Canada was colonized by Europeans gradually from the late 15th century to the mid-19th century, with the first permanent settlements established in the early 17th century, and eventual British domination and independence. The process took over 300 years.

instruction: How can I  use my phone less?
output:
Here are some tips to use your phone less:

• Turn off notifications. Disable notifications from apps that distract you the most like social media apps, games, etc. That way you're not tempted to check the phone when you get a notification.

• Limit check-ins. Decide on a limited number of times you will check your phone and stick to it. For example, limit yourself to checking just 3 times an hour or less.

• Remove social media apps. The social media apps are designed to keep you engaged and coming back. Remove apps like Facebook, Instagram, and Snapchat from your phone. You can still use them on your computer if needed.

• Find alternatives. Replace the urge to check your phone with another activity like reading a book, exercising, spending time with friends in person, etc. The more you engage in other activities, the less you will crave the phone.

• Use phone only for essential tasks. Only use your phone for making calls, texts, maps or other important apps. Remove entertainment apps and games. The more you reframe the phone as a utility device, the less urge you'll have to spend lots of time on it. 

• Track and limit your time. Use an app like QualityTime, BreakFree or Screen Time to set daily time limits for different apps and see how much you're actually using the phone. Awareness is the first step, then set reasonable limits and the app will lock you out when you reach the limit. 

• Turn on Airplane mode. When you don't need to be available, turn on the Airplane mode on your phone. That will disable all connectivity and notifications. You can still use the phone for music, camera, and other apps but not the distracting stuff.

• Find phone-free time. Establish tech-free zones like no phone during dinner time or 30 minutes before bedtime. Take longer phone-free breaks when possible like a weekend camping trip. The more you practice, the less fomo (fear of missing out) you'll have.

instruction: How did mankind discover that the earth was spherical, and why did they initially believe it to be flat?
output:
There are a few reasons why ancient peoples initially believed the earth to be flat:

1. Everyday experience. The local area that people could observe directly appeared flat. They had no easy way of seeing the curvature of the earth.

2. Lack of scientific knowledge. Ancient cultures lacked an understanding of gravity and the spherical shape of celestial bodies. They did not have a scientific reason to believe the earth was round.

3. Mythology and religion. Some ancient mythologies and religions featured a flat earth in their cosmologies. This reinforced the idea of a flat earth.

The ancient Greeks were the first to prove that the earth was round, not flat:

1. Observations of the curved shadow of the earth on the moon during lunar eclipses.

2. Observations that the North Star appeared higher in the sky when viewed from more northern locations. This suggested that the earth's surface was curved.

3. Circumnavigations of the earth. Some Greek explorers traveled great distances east and west and returned home, proving the earth was round.

4. Mathematical reasoning. Eratosthenes calculated the circumference of the earth around 240 BC using geometry and observations of the sun's position. This would not work on a flat earth.

5. Understanding of gravity. The ancient Greeks knew that spherical shapes were the natural form for large objects in space, due to the pull of gravity in all directions. So they deduced the earth was likely spherical too.

So in summary, mankind transitioned from a belief in a flat earth to a spherical one thanks to scientific reasoning, exploration, and discovery by the ancient Greeks, culminating in multiple proofs that the earth was undoubtedly round, not flat.

instruction: What is Gremolata?
output:
Gremolata is a chopped herb condiment typically made of garlic, parsley, and lemon zest. It is usually served as a garnish for braised veal shanks or osso buco. The fresh, vibrant herbs and citrus help balance the richness of the braised meat.

The basic ingredients for gremolata are:

• Finely chopped fresh parsley - Parsley provides fresh herbal flavor. Italian parsley is typically used.

• Grated lemon zest - The lemon zest adds a bright citrus note.

• Minced garlic - Garlic provides an aromatic punch and spice.

• Olive oil - Optional. Just a drizzle of olive oil helps the gremolata stick to the meat.

• Salt and pepper - Optional. Just a pinch of salt and pepper helps season the gremolata.

The ingredients are simply mixed together and sprinkled over the braised dish just before serving. The fresh, tangy flavors of the gremolata help enhance the hearty, savory flavors of the main dish. It adds texture, color and a burst of flavor with each bite.

Gremolata is also sometimes used as a condiment or garnish for other dishes like risotto, fish stews, roast pork, or polenta. It is a simple but impactful way to finish a dish.

instruction: Why did humans evolve to believe in God?
output:
There are several theories about why humans tend to believe in God or gods:

1. Evolutionary byproduct: Some scientists argue that belief in God emerged as an evolutionary byproduct of other useful human traits, such as detecting agency and intention in the world, emotional sensitivity, and the ability to hold abstract concepts. These useful traits may have made humans prone to believe in divine or supernatural agents.

2. Social cohesion: Belief in a common God or religion may help bond social groups together. Shared religious beliefs and rituals create a sense of shared identity and purpose. This may have had survival benefits in human evolution.

3. Explanatory tool: Belief in God may have emerged as a way for humans to explain aspects of the world that they did not understand. Divine agency was used to explain natural phenomena, life and death, and good and bad fortune. This tendency to attribute events to a divine being may have developed into belief in God.

4. Comfort and reduction of existential anxiety: Belief in God may provide a sense of comfort and security in the face of existential anxieties, such as death anxiety. The idea of divine protection and an afterlife may help alleviate such anxieties and make humans feel less alone or helpless.

5. Cultural learning: Once the idea of God or gods emerged in human cultures, it was passed on from generation to generation through cultural learning and social transmission. Young children are especially prone to absorb religious beliefs from their families and communities. This cultural learning process perpetuates belief in God.

So in summary, there are many factors that likely contributed to the evolution of belief in God, including both biological and cultural influences. There is no scientific consensus on a single explanation. It was probably an interplay between many of these influences.

instruction: what should i build a cabin out of?
output:
There are several good options for building a cabin:

• Logs - Log cabins are a classic, traditional choice. Logs provide good insulation and a rustic look. However, log cabins require a lot of maintenance and the logs can be expensive. Common types of wood for log cabins include cedar, pine, spruce, and fir.

• Wood boards - You can also build a cabin using standard dimensional lumber, like 2x4s and plywood sheets. This provides more flexibility in the cabin design. Wood board cabins require less maintenance than log cabins. Common types of wood include cedar, redwood, and pine.

• Stone - For a rugged, durable cabin, you can use stone materials like granite, sandstone, slate or fieldstone. Stone cabins typically last a long time but stone can be difficult to work with and very heavy. Mortar is required to join the stones together.

• Concrete - Concrete, especially insulated concrete forms or ICFs, can make an extremely durable, weather-resistant cabin. However, concrete can be expensive to work with and difficult to make look natural in a cabin setting.

• Metal - Metal cabins, built from materials like steel, aluminum or corrugated metal sheets can be inexpensive and low-maintenance. However, metal cabins typically don't have the classic cabin look and feel that wood or stone provides.

• Brick - Brick can also be used to construct an attractive, long-lasting cabin. Brick requires a concrete foundation and mortar to join the bricks. Brick cabins tend to be more expensive than other options.
